attributes.action: Horses Backed to Ride, Minimum Age Restriction
attributes.additional_details:
We ask the government to introduce new legislation under the Animal Welfare Act 2006 to limit the age in which any equines are broken/backed to ride.
As a horse welfare campaign group,we are regularly sent images by upset & angry people who see young horses,even 8 week old foals,being sat on by people or fully tacked up.This is abuse.
However,as there is no minimum age requirements as to what age a horse can be broken to ride,there is no law in which any welfare or police can act on,thereby allowing the horse to be in pain & irreparable damage to be inflicted on these horses & damaged physically/mentally for life.
Currently any ridden competition at a show or event has minimum age of 4.This does not stop the abuse happening at home.
We ask the government to introduce a minimum age of at least 2 yrs of age before a horse can be broken in to ride.
We request this is a prosecutable offence under the Animal Welfare Act 2006 & the police to enforce this legislation.
